medical_history.chief_complaint: Nausea, vomiting, subjective fever and abdominal cramping.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began 1 week ago, with frequent emesis (non-bloody, non-bilious), averaging several episodes a day. Patient is unable to keep anything down. Experienced 1 week of constipation followed by a large bowel movement, but no actual diarrhea.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Pervasive Developmental Disorder; Seizures at age 17; ?Bipolar Disorder.
medical_history.family_history: Family history significant for brother with substance abuse problems and attention difficulty; no family history of triglyceridemia.
